featured.text: Amy treasured the gold bracelet Laura gave her.
Nine proposals were submitted, and the Irish-born architect James Hoban won the gold medal for his practical and handsome design.
Higher ocean temperatures kill the important food source for the coral—the algae, the tiny greenish-gold water plants that live on coral.
It was discovered on the Chilkoot Pass, the famous trail used by the people seeking gold in Alaska.
Over 100,000 people with “gold fever” made this trip hoping to become millionaires.

other.text: The Canadian government made gold seekers bring one year’s supplies with them so that _______.
Bekoji’s legend Derartu Tulu, who won the 10,000-meter Olympic gold medals in 1992 and 2000, is a national hero.
The Canadian government finally started requiring the gold seekers to bring one ton of supplies with them.
Michael Phelps, an American swimmer, broke seven world records and won eight gold medals in men’s swimming _____ in the 2008 Olympics.
It was a thin gold chain with a heart dangling on it and Amy loved it the minute she saw it.
While winning a gold _____ is what every Olympic athlete dreams of, it becomes meaningless if it is achieved by cheating.
The women’s softball team that won gold for Japan at the Beijing Olympics is reported to have used blood-type theories to customize training for each player.
Amy made sure her gold bracelet was secure on her wrist.

So, when gold was discovered in the West in 1849, he 23 thousands of others and rushed to California. 24 he planned to open a shop in San Francisco, he took many goods with him, 25 a large quantity of canvas.

definition.zh_def: 一種貴金屬，顏色為金黃色，具有良好的導電性和抗腐蝕性，常用於珠寶和貨幣。
definition.en_def: A precious metal that is yellow in color, known for its excellent conductivity and resistance to corrosion, often used in jewelry and currency.
definition.example: She wore a beautiful gold necklace.
